original: @152a //'di ni dpal ldan lnga nas skya'i chos grva chen por dge slong rin chen rgyal mtshan gyis /
analyzed: @152a //'di ni dpal ldan lnga nas skya'i chos grva chen por dge slong rin chen rgyal mtshan gyis /
translated: This was written by the monk Rinchen Gyaltsen in the great temple of glorious Saṅnātha.

original: rgya dpe las bsgyur cing zhus te dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgya dpe las bsgyur cing zhus te dag par byas pa'o //
translated: This was translated, edited, and finalized by the bhikṣu Ratnavajra from the land of the five splendors in the great temple of Vikramaśīla.🔽May this be of benefit to many beings.

original: 'dis 'gro ba du ma la phan par gyur cig / ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'dis 'gro ba du ma la phan par gyur cig / ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra of the Gnosis ḍākinī is:

original: zhes 'bum phrag gsum yang dag par bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'bum phrag gsum yang dag par bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite it three hundred thousand times.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i sngags kyang bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i sngags kyang bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should also recite the mantras of Vajraḍāka and so forth.

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sa bon no ;
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sa bon no ;
translated: The seed syllables of the goddesses such as Gnosis ḍākinī are:

original: / h'um dang / h'um dang / h'um dang / a'a dang / a'im dang / aum dang / r'im dang / l'im dang / aeem dang / aoom dang / aa rnams yin no//
analyzed: / h'um dang / h'um dang / h'um dang / a'a dang / a'im dang / aum dang / r'im dang / l'im dang / aeem dang / aoom dang / aa rnams yin no//
translated: Hūṃ, hūṃ, hūṃ, ā, īṃ, ūṃ, ṛṃ, ḷṃ, aiṃ, oṃ, a.
